title: Ticket #7322: Container Port Forwarding
description:
Allow users to specify that some host port must forward to a particular container port.

doc https://docs.google.com/document/d/1laIjAizeO3HxWYea0k73NaDqZS2MVAS84DrV7Vj04NY

> On commit msg [58197], what does "Tracking commit" mean?

That the changes were not "complete" in some sense, but for whatever reason, I wanted them in version control anyway.  In this case, the changes were basically complete, but I hadn't been able to test them on the machine they were developed on, so I made a commit to aid transfer and in expectation of further changes.

> What does commit [58337] have to do with this ticket? Shouldn't this be a
> different ticket?

It didn't seem worth the trouble of writing a new ticket for a code clarification.  (It was coded wrong, but as I noted, the mistakes was not having any actual effect.)

2019-Nov-12 11:17:06 by tlmiller:
Docker port forwarding verified to work on Dumbo. Merged master again, checking for a clean build.

2019-Nov-12 11:20:42 by tlmiller:
  • Should still investigate the potential memory leak.
  • Need to think about if the job should go on hold if the port-forwarding specification is incomplete.

2019-Nov-12 16:17:10 by tlmiller:
Test run http://submit-3.batlab.org/results/run-details.php?runid=489026 looks good.

GregT points out that we need to remove the port forwarding information from the job ad when the starter exits; it will either be confusing (while the job isn't running) or stale (after it restarts somewhere else, but before the job ad in the schedd gets updated).

That will be a priority for this ticket (8.9.5 release), but reporting an error all the way back to the user if the port-forwarding attributes in their job ad aren't right is now follow-up ticket #7375.

I also still need to review for the possible memory leak.
